p: In response to the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) outbreak, Korea showed diagnostic capacity at scale. By massively testing and triaging people in the Daegu-Gyeongbuk area where the outbreak was centered [ 1], Korea was able to successfully implement containment efforts. By March 11, 2020, around 230 000 people had been testedâ€”almost triple the amount of those tested in Italy, and 20 times the amount tested in the United States [ 2]. Many factors enabled massive testing, including the rapid approval and availability of diagnostic kits, but without the doctors who actually performed nasal and oral swabs, this would not have been possible. However, this leads to an important question: how was Korea able to recruit enough doctors in such a short time?
